pros:
Welcoming environment
Can work from home
cons: There are occasional problems with IT

review_title: Paid for 1 job but asked to fulfill the work of 3
job_title: Customer Resolution Specialist in Euston, England
pros: Office Location in Euston really easy to get to, too many incidents at Watermill Lane office which is now closed anyhow
cons: Too many!! Workload was impossible, Heads if service didn’t support the operational challenges and there is a high turnover of staff. Too many cliques in higher management too that is never healthy for any organisation. Staff feel unsupported and there’s very little empathy if you speak about work stress.

pros: CEO genuinely cares about the staff and if she gets to knows you she does remember you and has time for you
cons:
Their whole approach to everything is reactive, no planning or logical thinking. 

Everyone has new manager and everyone is trying to impress everyone but the admin staff are the ones doing the work

job_title: Senior Lettings Manager in Stevenage, England
cons: Horrible and negative. Racist and unfair

job_title: Customer Service Agent in London, England
pros: Learnt how to use a lot of different applications
cons: Toxic colleagues, sporadic workload, .no one to discuss issues with

review_title: Great place to work, with a social purpose!
job_title: Technology Solutions Manager in London, England
pros: There is great progression with a lot of opportunities to advance and develop career. Good learning and studying opportunities and a real dedication to both staff and customers.
cons: The organisation has a lot of depths and layers and as a result can take time to understand its complexities.

pros:
Work from home and that's pretty much it. 
Nothing else stands out in terms of pros.
cons: Management are not experienced in the field, meaning staff have nobody to turn to. Seems they hite whoever 'face fits'

job_title: I Prefer Not to Say in London, England
pros: Great people, great place to work. Forward thinking housing association.
cons: Small teams so not much room for progression

pros: Flexibility, the staff are lovely, the hours are great and that’s where it ends.
cons: The organisation lacks accountability, staff are lazy and don’t do anything. Managers are equally as lazy and lack leadership. The pay is by far the lowest in the industry and you are held hostage with no pay increase for years if you manage to hit the 110%. Customer satisfaction is very low and colleagues think your a pain when you try and help the customers out. The level of complaints are on the increase because colleagues don’t care about their jobs and are constantly telling customers to complain knowing full well nothing gets done. The organisation should really start from starch. It’s ambitious in wanting to be better but needs the right people in the right places. Customers safety is put into jeopardy by the lack of compliance process. Where the contracts managers don’t care as long as they are being paid to do nothing. The customers are really the losers in this organisation and it pains me to see.

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Euston, England
pros: Good location and nice refurbished office.
cons:
Executive Leadership is poor and inconsistent.  Middle management in the main are lazy and not held to account. Other managers and staff are also generally lazy and avoid doing anything that means work and effort from them.  Care and Support is a shambles, it is incredible that the C&S management team have got away with it for so long. 
Too much emphasis has been placed on IT solutions to improve efficiency and customer service, rather than deal with the poor performance issues.
Organisation values are not upheld

job_title: Head of Communications in London, England
pros:
Friendly and great people
Interesting and varied roles across the organisation
Good support for people - well being and work life balance are important
People are engaged and put residents at the heart of what we do 
Innovation is encouraged
cons: Like most places there is some getting used to working more remotely and staying connected with residents

job_title: Assistant Director of Development in London, England
pros: Origin really has residents at the heart of everything is does. We are financially strong and have a large development programme.
cons: Along with every other RP we are adapting to news ways for working, with the aim of creating a better work life balance for staff.

job_title: Residential Support Worker in London, England
pros:
Rewarding Job 
Sufficient training 
Reasonable hours
cons:
No guidance towards progression 
Looked down on by head office staff 
Terrible HR 
Terrible staff retention 
Low pay

pros: most staff were very nice, lots of training chance to move up
cons: money did not go up over several years
